text:
hey everyone so a while back I released a video 
telling you a little bit about my life story

and then I promised that I would do another video 
answering any additional questions you might have

about me so I received a lot of questions from you 
guys and so today we will answer some of them and

I've got my cameraman Adam who will today do the 
honor of reading me those questions alright Adam

let's get started what is the meaning of the time 
for you to say at the start of each episode aha

so Sawaddee ka means hello basically but it is a 
woman's way of saying hello so Sawaddee is hello

and Ka is the way we add politeness if you are 
a woman so if you're a man you would not say so

what be cot you would say so I eat crap and crap 
is the suffix that makes it polite for me what was

the best in the worst parts of working as a chef 
hmm the best part I love the people who work in

the restaurant industry they are just a bunch of 
really fun people if you joke around is the most

casual working environment ever and I just really 
like that community and the worst part and it's

the reason why I got out is because I love the 
cooking and I love the creativity but I didn't

love the fact that there was a business to be run 
you know I love creating dishes but I didn't like

thinking about okay well is this doable is the 
food cost to hire people going to buy something

like this and and so this is why I love doing 
my youtube channel because I can really let my

creativity run free and I can do the dishes that I 
enjoy without having to think about how much do I

charge people for this dish do you have any plans 
to open your restaurant no it's I was there and I

got out and I have no plans of going back again 
when I was working in restaurants I learned a

lot it was incredible learning experience but 
my favorite part of working in the restaurant

industry was actually teaching the staff my 
recipes I really enjoy teaching people how to

cook and that's why I enjoy being here on YouTube 
so I think you know I found my place how difficult

was it for you to learn to speak English how long 
did it take you to complement so it was so it's

kind of a hard question it wasn't difficult per 
se I mean I learned English in Thai school as

a second language and it was always a subject I 
was good at I'm tend to be quite good at foreign

languages but how long it took me to become 
fluent in my about me sorry I told you that I

went to New Zealand when I went to New Zealand I 
spoke so little English and I remember the first

two weeks I didn't understand anything that was 
said in class and I think it took about a month

before I finally understood everything that was 
said more or less and maybe by the end of that

year that I was there I was fluent so it took a 
whole year of being fully immersed plus the basic

that I got from being in Thailand do you speak any 
other languages I I do but not fluently so I speak

a little bit of French chappal of Buddha fall 
sea but not fluently I speak enough to get by I

suppose other than Thai I speak Thai obviously and 
what else I speak kitchen Spanish I worked with a

lot of Mexicans when I worked in restaurants so I 
know a bunch of food names in Spanish but that's

it can you tell me some non-food related fun 
facts about yourself I love miniature versions

of everything like my mini whisk and mini spatula 
and mini both I just I have a thing for small tiny

things not just naturally tiny things they have 
to be tiny versions of a naturally bigger thing

and I love them that's really random but dogs 
like dogs puppies are better than non puppies

right your pie what is your least favorite food 
I hate licorice like it's it shouldn't be a food

you know the licorice black licorice candy just 
just so awful we never had a licorice in Thailand

growing up and then I came to Canada maybe it 
was New Zealand I remember my first experience

where it was but somebody gave it to me like 
it was candy all right so that all candy I put

in my mouth and I thought I was going to die it 
was terribly terribly just I don't know if it's

bitter it was just awful like and I don't think it 
should be counted as the food it's like medicine

what is your favorite ingredient apart from fish 
sauce that's obvious right kaffir lime leaves I

love it I every time I use it I cannot help but 
tear and smell it before I use it like before I

film I feel like every time I bring it out and 
I have to smell it before you use it I think

it's good and everything I want to spray it in 
my house I want to rub it on myself I just wish

the world fell like kaffir lime leaves living far 
from your parents and relatives even though you

visit them once a year or so do you feel lonely 
sometimes sometimes it definitely I mean I'm so

busy most of the time running around I don't 
think about it much but every once in a while

especially when I'm with someone else's family I 
will miss my family you know like it's Easter or

Thanksgiving or whatever it is and you know I'm 
always that one person that doesn't have a family

thing to go to so yeah every once in a while I 
definitely missed them I try to talk to my my

mom on the phone once a once every few weeks my 
dad's more of an email guy so I email him I text

my brother's quite a bit yeah so but it does 
get lonely and that's why I go back every year

but I have a lot of fun love really good friends 
here and I'm busy and I'm doing stuff that I love

doing so it's you know balances out in the end you 
would never go back to live in Thailand I thought

about it I've thought about it not immediately 
just because of all this work that I've got here

but yeah it's in the realm of possibility and that 
is it that's all I've got for you today if you got

more questions definitely send them on however 
don't leave your questions in the comment section

okay there are a lot of comments and sometimes 
I miss them so if you have a question that you

want to be a part of these ask me anything video 
series send them through the contact form on my

website haughty [ __ ] calm and I will not miss 
those okay and that is it and I will see you

next time you realize you could have licorice 
with a DNA licorice licorice licorice same Sam
